title: Europe from May to December,
author: Williams, Rudolph.
snippet: The storm made plenty of sun, and we all laughed at the ridiculousness of our situation, the whole situation, until we were tired. At five-fifteen we rolled into Glengariff, and filled the little Bellevue Hotel so full of guests that I think the proprietor is grinning yet.

title: Old diaries, 1881-1901 /
author: Gower, Ronald Sutherland
snippet: Few capitals can lend themselves better or more effectually to street decoration than Dresden ; the bridge is especially beautiful, covered with pennons. I put up at the Bellevue Hotel, where I stayed when here ten years ago. The appearance of the town this evening, as seen from the steps which lead up to the Briihl Terrace, was a

title: A physician's vacation;
author: Channing, Walter 1786-1876. [from old catalog]
snippet: Cologne. — I am now in the Cologne Bellevue Hotel, —
